messages.title: 60 secs with...
messages.content: Interview snippets discussing Gerald Vernon-Jackson's connection with the people, his pride in being from Portsmouth, and touching on his experience and continuity in service.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Promising to allow families to spend their money how they like by putting £1,200 back in their pockets.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Lib Dems deliver on jobs and apprenticeships
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Highlighting the delivery of new jobs and the creation of a record number of apprenticeships.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Lib Dems pledge £8 billion for our NHS
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Committing to investing £8 billion in the NHS by 2020 to improve care.
Plans to end discrimination against mental health in the workplace, and ensuring those with mental health conditions are treated fairly.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Discussion of the 'two horse race' between the Lib Dems and Tories in Portsmouth South.

issues.economy: Discussing the creation of jobs, support for apprenticeships, and mentioning the recovery after the economic crisis.
issues.health: Promises for the future funding of the NHS and emphasizing mental health issues.

housing.content: Touching on the subject of housing by promising to build the houses that Britain needs while ensuring they're affordable.

leaflet.personalStatement: Gerald Vernon-Jackson discusses his personal connection and commitment to Portsmouth, his pride in his work and achievements.

politicalExperience.role: Leader of the City Council for 10 years
politicalExperience.achievements: Delivering services and infrastructure development, maintaining libraries, keeping council tax low, and sustaining jobs during the recession.

images.caption: Image of Gerald Vernon-Jackson engaging with members of the community, including a visit to a school and sitting down with residents.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet includes testimonials from residents, review of the 'The Magazine' and comparisons between Lib Dem and Conservative contributions in the area.
